bibl.title: Letter from Alton P. Tisdel to Philip Showalter Hench, August 9, 1937

div1.p: Tisdel informs Hench that the Government Printing Office has mailed a copy of the Yellow Fever Commission report to him.

div1.head: Letter from Alton P. Tisdel to Philip Showalter Hench, August 9, 1937
div1.opener:
mdk
UNITED STATE OF AMERICA
GOVERNMENT PRINTING OFFICE
UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT PRINTING OFFICE
WASHINGTON, D. C.
August 9, 1937.
OFFICE OF
SUPERINTENDENT OF DOCUMENTS
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Referring to your letter of July 6th, I have to advise
that we were able to locate for you a copy of Senate Document 822, 61st
Congress, 3d Session, The Report of the Yellow Fever Commission, which we
mailed to you on the 3d. The cost of this publication is 45¢ which amount
I would appreciate your remitting marked for the personal attention of Mrs.
Kidwell.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, ALTON P. TISDEL
Superintendent of Documents. Ga
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
